choices.B: the ability to have forwarding tables at each device
choices.D: the ability to configure the features for the network rather than per device
choices.C: programmatic APIs that are available per device

discussion.content:

Answer A/D:

questions.question_text: What are two advantages of controller-based networks versus traditional networks? (Choose two.)

discussion.content: CE is correct. Endpoints does not mean the servers

Selected Answer: CE
CE for sure.

Selected Answer: BE
Endpoints connect only to the spine switches: In a standard spine and leaf architecture, endpoints such as servers or storage devices connect only to the spine switches, and not directly to the leaf switches. This is because the spine switches act as the core of the network, providing high-speed connectivity and traffic aggregation.

comments.content: Endpoints must never connect to spines as it limits the scalability of spines' FIB especially with EVPN VXLAN overlay!
Surely not, lots of servers and storage connect to leaf. That's the design of DC switches. Aggregrate the links if not enough bandwidth.
totally agreed. spine is comparable to core and core is all about highspeed transit, no services or servers.

questions.question_text: What are two design constraints in a standard spine and leaf architecture? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Spine switches can connect to each other
choices.C: Each spine switch must connect to every leaf switch
choices.D: Leaf switches must connect to each other
choices.E: Each leaf switch must connect to every spine switch
choices.B: Endpoints connect only to the spine switches

choices.D: hosts locating routers that reside on attached links using the IPv6 Neighbor Discover Protocol

choices.B: matching the destination MAC address of an Ethernet frame to the MAC address table
choices.A: de-encapsulating and re-encapsulating a packet in a data-link frame

questions.question_text:
A network architect in an enterprise is designing a network policy for certain database applications. The goal of the policy is to allow these applications to access the internet directly, whereas other user and network applications that communicate with systems or users outside their own network must be routed through the data center. The focus is on achieving higher availability and a better user experience for the database applications, but switching between different network paths based on performance characteristics must be supported.

Which solution meets these requirements?

discussion.content:
B
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/solutions/collateral/enterprise-networks/sd-wan/nb-06-cloud-onramp-saas-faq-cte-en.html

Selected Answer: B
Cisco's Cloud onRamp for SaaS is a feature of Cisco SD-WAN (Software-Defined Wide Area Networking) solution that simplifies and optimizes connectivity to Software as a Service (SaaS) applications. It enables organizations to securely connect users to SaaS applications directly from branch locations, bypassing the traditional backhaul to the data center approach

Selected Answer: B
Cloud onRamp for IaaS (C) is a solution that focuses on providing secure and optimized connectivity to Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS) environments. While it may provide some benefits for network connectivity, it does not directly address the requirement of allowing direct internet access for specific database applications.

Selected Answer: B
Should be B

C is correct.
Infrastructure-as-a-Service (IaaS): In IaaS, the public cloud provider offers access to fundamental compute, network, and storage resources on demand over the public Internet or through dedicated connections.
C is correct

comments.content: I would say A is misleading. If it was automation, it would be ZTP, right? As for C, Network Automation certainly can't do governance, but orchestration could.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
• B. Network orchestration is used to run single, low-level tasks without human intervention:
 • This statement is more aligned with network automation rather than orchestration. Orchestration typically involves coordinating multiple tasks and systems, not just single, low-level tasks.
 • C. Network automation does not provide governance or policy management:
 • This statement is misleading because modern network automation tools often include features for governance and policy management to ensure compliance and enforce security policies.
 • D. Network automation spans multiple network services, vendors, and environments:
 • This statement describes network orchestration more accurately. Orchestration spans across different services, vendors, and environments to provide a cohesive management approach.

Selected Answer: CE
automation deals primarily with automating single tasks - orchestration deals with multiple processes, workflows, systems
